Until relatively recently, the sugar beet was labor-intensive, each crop’s fate bound up in weeding and spacing that can be hard to do any other way than by hand. Sugar beets required “stoop labor,” not far from the labor-intensive nature of sugar cane. They are also known to be “water hogs,” taking 800 pounds of water to produce one pound of sugar.
